content.description: Sit start in the middle of the west face.  climb desperate move on crimps to a tricky topout.
Sit start on low blocky holds on the west side of the largest boulder. Climb the arret using pockets and crimps.
On the southern end of the western face of the largest of the lower boulders. This one move wonder required a longish reach to a pocket and then an easy hike to the top
content.location: around the corner to the left of the main wall on the large boulder (to the immediate left of "unnamed steep blunt face")

content.description: There are about three distinct lines that start to the right of a descent gully on the west face. Go straight up using positive holds on lower angle face. All three lines go at about 5.4 YDS.
content.protection: crash pad, spotters, helmets, first aid crew
content.location: on the west face - around the left hand side from the main (southern face) wall, to the right of a descent gully

content.description: A nice steep overhanging face with a few crimps and pockets, to a slab top-out.
content.location: On the main boulder, facing the road.

content.description: A bit contrived as it is sort of close to the regular start but fun nonetheless. Sit start with right hand in small shallow sloped pocket and left hand in two finger pocket. Figure out your feet and pull a rad swingy dynamic move over the lip to a sloper. Do a campus move to acquire the good holds. You can top out straight up or follow the v2 arete up to the right. Do whatever makes you happy.
content.location: the seemingly blank face under the unknown arete.

content.description: Start low on the very steep arete with a funky slot for the right hand and a left heel hook.  Yard out the arete topping out when the climb comes over another small boulder.  Bring lots of core tension.
content.protection: Pads and an attentive spotter, especially for the last moves.
content.location: In the lower boulder this is the lone problem on the boulder up the hill and right a ways from the main warm-up boulder.

content.description: Start at the right end of the boulder and traverse left keeping your hands at the lip.  The crux is getting going right from the start and it eases considerably as you move left.  A good warm up.  You will top out 10 feet before the left end of the boulder
content.location: On the main face of the big lower boulder.  You will see chalk.

content.description: Start on far right jug hueco. traverse left on chest level holds. Big rail is off. Traverse 30 feet, past bulge to a good crimp and a left hand pinch and dyno to the two big pinch/huecos and climb to the top.
content.protection: pad and spotter for the dyno.

content.description:
Crux is going left around the bulgy arete. Whole thing is good with long moves and a sweet topout.

 From the starting holds, move left out around the cruxy arete bulge on smallish crimps/sidepulls. Throw to high large hueco on main face before moving down jugs, crimps and rails to a well deserved rest at the huge jug prior to topping out on reachy pockets.

 Best problem on the lower boulders.
content.location: Start is found around the right side of the main face on primary lower boulder. Start with left hand gaston in chalked up hueco and right hand in small pocket up and right.

content.description: One of the few independent-looking lines in the middle of the main face.  Pulling on is hard from the low sit start and the moves are longer.  Be careful of the pockets.
content.location: Begin in the head-sized hueco low in the middle of the face.

content.description: Yard on from the low sit start and trend left using anything in your reach.  Just like the right variation this climb is more strenuouse than it looks.
content.location: Begin in the middle of the face low on the head-sized hueco.
The rear descent side of main boulder

content.description: Climb up the primary groove on the right side of the main wall of the largest of the lower boulders. Route starts at shoulder height and ascends the groove via the largest hole on the boulder, topping out on the block above the large hole. Crux is the throw for the large hole.
content.location: Climb the groove to the largest hole on the main face. Top out on the block above. See beta photo

content.description: Sit start on a block to the right of a huge pocket. Climb right on crimps to a tough cross through into the starting holds for "unknown arete" and finish that problem.
content.location: On right leaning boulder oppostie the main lower boulder.

content.description: These are the first boulders encountered upon crossing the road.  There is a very large boulder on the left with some good warm-up problems and lots of possibilities for eliminates.  Another boulder off to the right and further from the road has an excellent V3 on a very steep arete.
